actor_awards.notes: Ustinov won Oscars for Best Supporting Actor in 'Spartacus' and 'Topkapi'. He was knighted in 1990 for his contributions to the arts and humanitarian work with UNICEF.

filmography.title: Spartacus
filmography.role_description: The wily, sycophantic owner of a gladiator school who buys Spartacus and inadvertently sparks the slave revolt.
filmography.plot: The slave Spartacus leads a violent revolt against the decadent Roman Republic.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Topkapi
filmography.role_description: A small-time, bumbling con man who is unwittingly recruited as the 'fall guy' for a high-stakes jewel heist in Istanbul.
filmography.plot: A group of jewel thieves plans to steal the emerald-encrusted dagger of Sultan Mahmud I from the Topkapi Palace in Istanbul.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Actor (Comedy/Musical)

filmography.title: Quo Vadis
filmography.role_description: The insane, petulant Roman Emperor who burns Rome to inspire his poetry and blames the Christians for the destruction.
filmography.plot: A Roman commander falls in love with a Christian hostage during the reign of the tyrannical Emperor Nero.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Supporting Actor; Oscar: Nominated – Best Supporting Actor

filmography.title: Death on the Nile
filmography.role_description: Agatha Christie's famous Belgian detective, who must solve a murder on a luxurious steamer cruising down the Nile.
filmography.plot: As Hercule Poirot enjoys a luxurious cruise down the Nile, a newlywed heiress is found murdered on board.

filmography.title: Billy Budd
filmography.role_description: The conflicted captain of a British warship who must decide the fate of an innocent sailor accused of mutiny.
filmography.plot: In the British Navy of 1797, a naive young sailor is court-martialed for murder after striking a sadistic master-at-arms.
filmography.awards: Writers Guild of America: Nominated – Best Written American Drama (Ustinov)

filmography.title: Logan's Run
filmography.role_description: An eccentric, cat-loving hermit living in the ruins of Washington D.C. who teaches the protagonists about the concepts of old age and family.
filmography.plot: An idylllic sci-fi future has one major drawback: life must end at the age of 30.

filmography.title: Robin Hood
filmography.role_description: Ustinov voices the thumb-sucking, cowardly lion Prince John and his regal brother King Richard in this Disney animated classic.
filmography.plot: The story of the legendary outlaw is portrayed with the characters as humanoid animals.

filmography.title: The Sundowners
filmography.role_description: A refined, witty Englishman who becomes a sheep drover in the Australian outback.
filmography.plot: In 1920s Australia, a family of shepherds moves from place to place, driving sheep and shearing them for a living.

filmography.title: Evil Under the Sun
filmography.role_description: Poirot investigates the murder of a despised Broadway star at an exclusive island resort in the Adriatic.
filmography.plot: Trying to find how a millionaire's diamond became a fake, Poirot visits an exclusive island resort frequented by the rich and famous.

filmography.title: Lorenzo's Oil
filmography.role_description: A skeptical medical establishment figure who clashes with the desperate parents trying to cure their son's rare disease.
filmography.plot: A dedicated couple searches for a cure for their son's rare disease, ALD, against the advice of doctors.

filmography.title: Blackbeard's Ghost
filmography.role_description: The ghost of the notorious pirate who is cursed to limbo until he performs a good deed, which involves helping a college track team.
filmography.plot: The ghost of the legendary pirate Blackbeard returns to our time to help a track coach's team win.

filmography.title: Hot Millions
filmography.role_description: A charming embezzler who poses as a computer expert to hack a corporate mainframe and steal millions.
filmography.plot: A con man just out of prison uses a computer to embezzle money from a large corporation, but his plans are complicated by a dizzy secretary.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nominated – Best Original Screenplay (Ustinov & Ira Wallach)

filmography.title: We're No Angels
filmography.role_description: One of three convicts who escape Devil's Island and decide to help a struggling family rather than rob them.
filmography.plot: Three escaped convicts from Devil's Island hide out in the home of a kindly but inept merchant and his family.

filmography.title: Lola Montès
filmography.role_description: The ringmaster of a circus who narrates the scandalous life of the famous courtesan Lola Montès as she performs for the crowd.
filmography.plot: The life of the famous dancer and courtesan Lola Montès is told through a series of flashbacks in a circus setting.

filmography.title: The Way Ahead
filmography.role_description: A cafe owner in North Africa; Ustinov also co-wrote the screenplay for this morale-boosting WWII film.
filmography.plot: A diverse group of British civilians are drafted into the infantry during WWII and molded into a cohesive fighting unit.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Odette
filmography.role_description: A radio operator for the French Resistance who works alongside the heroine Odette Sansom.
filmography.plot: The true story of Odette Sansom, a French woman who became a British spy during WWII and survived torture by the Gestapo.

filmography.title: One of Our Dinosaurs Is Missing
filmography.role_description: A Chinese intelligence officer trying to recover a secret microfilm hidden in a dinosaur skeleton.
filmography.plot: A microfilm is hidden in a dinosaur skeleton in a museum, leading to a chase between British nannies and Chinese spies.

filmography.title: Hotel Sahara
filmography.role_description: The owner of a desert hotel who tries to keep his business running by catering to whichever army occupies the area.
filmography.plot: A hotel owner in the Sahara Desert tries to save his hotel and his fiancée from the various armies passing through during WWII.

filmography.title: The Egyptian
filmography.role_description: The wily, one-eyed servant of the physician Sinuhe, who provides comic relief and practical wisdom.
filmography.plot: In ancient Egypt, a poor orphan becomes a brilliant physician and journeys across the known world.

filmography.title: Romanoff and Juliet
filmography.role_description: The leader of the tiny nation of Concordia who tries to manipulate the US and USSR into a romance between their ambassadors' children.
filmography.plot: In a small European country, the daughter of the American ambassador falls in love with the son of the Soviet ambassador.
filmography.awards: Berlin International Film Festival: Nominated – Golden Bear

filmography.title: Luther
filmography.role_description: The Elector of Saxony who protects Martin Luther from the wrath of the Pope and the Emperor.
filmography.plot: A biography of Martin Luther, the 16th-century priest who started the Protestant Reformation.

filmography.title: Ashanti
filmography.role_description: A ruthless slave trader who kidnaps the wife of a British doctor, sparking a chase across Africa.
filmography.plot: A doctor's wife is kidnapped by slave traders in West Africa, and he embarks on a dangerous journey to rescue her.

filmography.title: Dead Man's Folly
filmography.role_description: Poirot is invited to a murder mystery game at a country estate that turns into a real murder investigation.
filmography.plot: Hercule Poirot is called to a country estate to oversee a 'Murder Hunt' game, but things turn deadly real.

filmography.title: Animal Farm
filmography.role_description: The wise old prize boar who inspires the animals to revolt against their human masters with his vision of equality.
filmography.plot: The animals of a farm successfully revolt against their human owner, only to slide into a more brutal tyranny among themselves.

filmography.title: Alice in Wonderland
filmography.role_description: Ustinov plays the Walrus in the 'Walrus and the Carpenter' segment, reciting poetry to oysters before eating them.
filmography.plot: A girl falls down a rabbit hole into a fantasy world populated by peculiar, anthropomorphic creatures.
filmography.awards: Emmy: Won 4 awards (makeup, costume, music, VFX)
